articles.author: Frederic Lardinois
articles.title: Microsoft launches Windows 10 on ARM, with HP and ASUS promising 20+ hours of battery life
articles.description: Windows laptops and tablets have traditionally run on X86 processors from the likes of Intel and AMD. Microsoft experimented with using ARM-based processors when it launched the Surface RT and Windows RT in 2012 — and it cost the company dearly. Fast-forward …
